intro: Corispermum stauntonii subsp. sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian sandmat, is a flowering plant in the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or saline soils. Its leaves are usually oblanceolate and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The species is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient component of steppe and desert ecosystems.
